column1: 9032232,s0,T1,T2,Effect of association with ,adenylyl cyclase-associated protein, on the interaction of yeast ,adenylyl cyclase," with Ras protein.

9032232,s1,T13,T3,Posttranslational modification of ,Ras, protein has been shown to be critical for interaction with its effector molecules, including Saccharomyces cerevisiae ",adenylyl cyclase,.,Complex_formation

9032232,s3,T15,T5,"In this study, we used a reconstituted system with purified adenylyl cyclase and Ras proteins carrying various degrees of the modification to show that the posttranslational modification, especially the farnesylation step, is responsible for 5- to 10-fold increase in ",Ras,-dependent activation of ,adenylyl cyclase, activity even though it has no significant effect on their binding affinity.,Complex_formation

9032232,s3,T14,T15,"In this study, we used a reconstituted system with purified adenylyl cyclase and ",Ras," proteins carrying various degrees of the modification to show that the posttranslational modification, especially the farnesylation step, is responsible for 5- to 10-fold increase in ",Ras,-dependent activation of adenylyl cyclase activity even though it has no significant effect on their binding affinity.,Not_a_complex

9032232,s4,T6,T16,The stimulatory effect of farnesylation is found to depend on the association of ,adenylyl cyclase, with 70-kDa adenylyl cyclase-associated protein (,CAP,"), which was known to be required for proper in vivo response of adenylyl cyclase to Ras protein, by comparing the levels of Ras-dependent activation of purified adenylyl cyclase with and without bound CAP.",Complex_formation

9032232,s7,T11,T23,These results indicate that the association of ,adenylyl cyclase, with ,CAP," is responsible for the stimulatory effect of posttranslational modification of Ras on its activity and that this may be the mechanism underlying its requirement for the proper in vivo cyclic AMP response.

,Complex_formation

,Not_a_complex
